original_definition: 'biomass' means the biodegradable fraction of products, waste and residues from biological origin from agriculture (including vegetal and animal substances), forestry and related industries including fisheries and aquaculture, as well as the biodegradable fraction of industrial and municipal waste;
generated_definition: NO JSON AS AN OUTPUT OBTAINED

Article 2: ‘biomass’ means the biodegradable fraction of products, waste and residues from biological origin from agriculture (including vegetal and animal substances), forestry and related industries including fisheries and aquaculture, as well as the biodegradable fraction of industrial and municipal waste;
‘solid fuel’ means a fuel that is solid at normal indoor room temperatures, including solid biomass and solid fossil fuel;
‘fossil fuel’ means fuel other than biomass, including anthracite, brown coal, coke, bituminous coal; for the purposes of this Regulation it also includes peat;
‘solid fuel’ means a fuel that is solid at normal indoor room temperatures, including solidbiomassand solidfossil fuel;
‘fossil fuel’ means fuel other thanbiomass, including anthracite, brown coal, coke, bituminous coal; for the purposes of this Regulation it also includes peat;
Article 9: Other blend of biomass and fossil fuel
‘fossil fuel boiler’ means a solid fuel boiler that has fossil fuel or a blend of biomass and fossil fuel as preferred fuel;
